title.en: My Mom Got a Contract Marriage

altTitles.en: My Mom Entered a Contract Marriage
My Mother Got Married by Contract

altTitles.fr: Le mariage contractuel de ma mère

altTitles.es: Mi madre se caso por contrato

altTitles.th: เมื่อคุณแม่ของฉันทำสัญญาวิวาห์

description.en:
Lilyca is a poor girl who used to spend every day with her alcoholic mother.

However, one day...

"Kyaa, it's hot! No!"

Her mother woke up screaming and nonsensically asked, "Lily, you're alive! Have you gotten younger?"

"What's the date?"

She'd lost her mind!

"This can't be... I've come back!"

She started spouting more puzzling things, even going so far as to say, "We need to go to the Imperial Ball and meet the Emperor!"

Lilyca began to worry that something had gone wrong with her Mother's head...

---
Lyrica is a hardworking 8-year-old girl who has always used her vivid imagination to escape the harsh realities of living in the slums with her neglectful mother. After her mother has a premonition of a disastrous future, she snaps to her senses and devises a plan to provide a different life for Lyrica. But even Lyrica couldn't have imagined that the plan was to marry the emperor! Now that she has everything she could ever dream of, can Lyrica face reality in spite of her wild imagination?

---

description.es:
Lyrica es una niña que vive en un barrio marginal y vive día a día con su madre borracha.   Entonces un día...   “¡Ay, hace calor! ¡no!"   Madre despertó gritando,   "Lily, estás viva, ¿eres joven?"   dices tonterias   "¿Qué fecha es hoy?"   No pude volver a mis sentidos   “¡Oh no, he vuelto!”   Incluso comenzó a hacer sonidos incomprensibles.   ¡Incluso las palabras absurdas de “¡Tengo que asistir al Baile del Palacio Imperial y conocer a Su Majestad!”!   Ririka comienza a preocuparse por en qué se ha convertido el cabello de su madre...

---

description.fr:
Lilyca était une jeune fille des bidonvilles qui vivait avec sa mère alcoolique... Cependant un jour, sa mère s'est réveillée en sursaut: «Lily, tu es vivante! Comment peux-tu être plus jeune? Mais quel jour sommes-nous? Oh mon Dieu, je suis de retour!» Puis elle paniqua et ajouta: «Je dois aller au bal impérial et rencontrer sa Majesté!» Quelles sont ces absurdités? Je commençais à me demander ce qui était arrivée à ma mère...

---
